Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]When the focus is on "Provide custom message" text-box, Narrator focus is shifting to "S" letter of "Save" button" (#7893) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069923
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Tab till "Deprecation" section and press enter to expand it​
10.Tab till "Provide custom message" text-box and check if the Narrator focus is on the same​
​
Actual Result:​
When the focus is on "Provide custom message" text-box, Narrator focus is shifting to "S" letter of "Save" button and it is reading as "Provide Custom Message - Edit - Test Deletion - Cap S"
​
NOTE: NVDA is reading "Provide custom message" text box correctly

Expected Result:​
When the focus is on "Provide custom message" text-box, Narrator focus  should be on the same text box and it should only read "Provide Custom Message - Edit - Test Deletion"

Notes:
I was unable to reproduce this. Focus went in to the textbox as expected. Let's verify again that this is behaving as expected and then close it out.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading out every row in the same table" (#7892) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069968
Screen Reader: 
Narrator
​
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org"
2.Tab till "Packages" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till any existing package and press enter​
4.Tab till "GitHub Usage" section and press enter​ to expand it
5.Turn on scan mode for Narrator using Caps Lock+ Space bar
6.Using 'T' key, navigate to different tables on the page
7.Check if the Narrator is navigating to different rows of the same table on 'T' key press
​
Actual Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading out every row in the same table

NOTE: NVDA is working as expected(added attachment for reference)

Expected Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator focus should navigate to different tables of the page and not to different rows in same table

Notes:
This seems related to https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7891 in the narrator is seeing tables where there are not any.
I suspect that the rows in the GitHub usage section are being read as tables, either from layout or explicit tags. We should modify this section to look more like the version table below it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading as "table with 0 rows and 0 columns" even though there are no tables" (#7891) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069945
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Turn on scan mode for Narrator by pressing Caps lock + Space bar
10.Now press 'T' key and check the Narrator behavior ​
​
Actual Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading as "table with 0 rows and 0 columns" even though there are no tables
​
NOTE: NVDA is working as expected(added attachment for reference)

Expected Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator should read as "no next table" when there are no tables on the page
​
Notes:
Couldn't get scan mode working without exploding my browser. I am unsure of why a table is being read out. I suspect there is a table somewhere hidden that is being fed into the narrator.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Narrator is not reading the heading "Deprecation" on 'H' key press in scan mode " (#7890) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069941
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Turn on scan mode for Narrator by pressing Caps lock + Space bar
10.Now press 'H' key and check if narrator focus is navigating to headings (Deprecation) on the page​
​
Actual Result:​
Narrator is not reading the heading "Deprecation" on 'H' key press in scan mode
​
NOTE: NVDA is working as expected(added attachment for reference)

Notes:
I wasn't able to get scan mode working without crashing my browser. I suspect that it is simply missing an attribute that is on the other headings.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Narrator is reading improper role for Expand/Collapse button" (#7889) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069656
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
3.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
4.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
5.Tab till "Deprecation" section, enter required details, tab till "Save" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the package name in breadcrumb navigation and press enter​
7.Navigate to https://www.nuget.org/packages/DeltaX.fabel/​
8.Tab till the expand button present for the alert message that is displayed below the page heading​
9.Verify if the screen reader is reading the proper role for Expand/Collapse button​
​
Actual Result:​
Narrator is reading the Expand/Collapse button as "Group"
​
NOTE: NVDA is reading the role as button but it is not announcing the state(expanded/collapsed)

Expected Result:​
Narrator should read the role as button. Also, Narrator should read the state of the expand/collapse button, e.g.: button Expanded

Notes:
Giving this element a role="button" attribute seems to fix this issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Narrator is not reading the labels for "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" check-box group" (#7888) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069752
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Tab till "Deprecation" section and press enter to expand it​
10.Tab till "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" and check if the screen reader is reading the associated labels​
​
Actual Result:​
Narrator is not reading the labels for "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" check-box group
​
NOTE: NVDA is also not reading the labels

Expected Result:​
Narrator and NVDA should read the labels for "Select Version(s)" drop-down and "Select reason(s)" check-box group

Notes:
First scenario seems fine. When drop down for Selected Versions is focused, narrator reads out Select Version. For Select Reason, each checkbox only has the description of the checkbox itself, not that is is part of selecting a reason. We can probalby update to "Select Reason etcetc" for this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2020.03.19]RI dev to master" (#7887) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[A11y]Narrator unnecessarily announces table for "Upload Your Package" control" (#7886) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069499
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the #URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Turn on narrator navigate to "Upload Your Package" control using "Caps+Arrow" keys.
6. Observe Screen reader announcement.

Actual:
Narrator unnecessarily announces table for "Upload Your Package" control.

Same issue is observed in chrome+NVDA


Image

Expected:
Narrator should announce the proper name of the "Upload Your Package" control. It should not announce it as table.

Notes:
On repro attempt, narrator read out "Upload, Button, Expanded" and did not read out table. Verify that this doesn't repro and we can close it out.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Focus is not visible on the expand/collapse button" (#7885) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069655
Repro Steps:​
1.Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
3.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
4.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
5.Tab till "Deprecation" section, enter required details, tab till "Save" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the package name in breadcrumb navigation and press enter​
7.Navigate to https://www.nuget.org/packages/DeltaX.fabel/​
8.Tab till the expand button present for the alert message that is displayed below the page heading​
9.Verify if the focus is visible on the Expand/Collapse button​
​
Actual Result:​
Focus is not visible on the expand/collapse button​
​
Expected Result:​
Focus should be clearly visible on the expand/collapse button​

Notes:
We will need to add some stuff in our CSS for the deprecation container focus outline. The current appears to be overridden to be non-existent.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Incorrect name property provided for the "Custom" tab item." (#7884) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069506
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Custom" control and hit enter.
6. Open AI4D.
7. Check name property for the "Cutom" tab item.

Actual:
For the "Custom" tab item, Incorrect name property provided. 

Expected:
For the "Custom" tab item, Name property should provided correctly and screen reader should announces the same.

Notes:
Looks like we set the name of this to "Enter readme in Markdown"
We can probably either change this to be "Custom Markdown" or "Custom" assuming that the context of this is sufficient. I lean towards not fix since this is more descriptive from a usability perspective.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]The narrator announces same name for all 3 actionable images present under Owner section" (#7883) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1067633
Repro Steps:
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Search for a key term (say “json”) from search box.
5. Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
6. Navigate to "Owners" section present on bottom right of the screen.
7. Turn on the narrator.
8. Check if the narrator announces the correct name for all the 3 images in owner section.

Actual:
The narrator announces the same name like "gravatar" for all the 3 images under owner section.

Same issue is Observed in "NVDA" also.

Expected:
The narrator should announce the names of the 3 images differently as all the 3 images are actionable imags it should have different name.

Notes:
All 3 images in the describes owners section have alt text of 'gravatar'
I am not 100% sure if we can hijack the alt text here, but if we can, we could update the text to read as the owner.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]'MIT' Link is not descriptive." (#7882) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1063680
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Search for a key term (say “json”) from search box.
5. Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
6. Navigate to "Info" and "Statistics" section present on right of the screen.
7. Start the Narrator.
8. Navigate to "MIT" link under info.
9. Observe the Narrator announces the "MIT" link descriptively or not.
 
Actual:
Narrator is not announcing the proper description of 'MIT' link.

Similar issue has been observed with Chrome+NVDA

Expected:
The narrator should announce the description of the link.

Notes:
Context may be lost here that 'MIT' is actually descriptive of the license type. We should add an aria-label indicating "License type: MIT" or something similar.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]The Keyboard focus is not visible on selected item from the table." (#7881) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1063683
Repro Steps:
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Search for a key term (say “json”) from search box.
5. Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
6. Navigate to "Version History" control and hit enter.
7. Turn on high contrast.
8.Check if in high contrast the row that is selected(highlighted),the same highlighted row is also visible in high contrast while navigating using Tab key.

Actual:
The keyboard focus on selected item from the table is not clearly visible in high contrast black/white mode.

Similar issue have been observed in below scenarios : 
1).Json ->OwnerSection
Repro Steps:
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Search for a key term (say “json”) from search box.
5. Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
6. Navigate to "Owners" section present on bottom right of the screen.
7. Check if the image of "newtonsoft" is visible in high contrast black mode.
1063683_A11y_[BM]NuGetService_OwnerSection_HighContrast.PNGBug_1063683_A11y_[BM]NuGetService_OwnerSection_HighContrast.PNG

Expected:
The focus on the selected item from the table should be clearly visible in high contrast mode.

Notes:
I was actually unable to reproduce case 1 at all. The table highlights keyboard focus correctly without issue. The only possible issue is that the light blue that indicates which version page we are on is not visible in high contrast.
For case 2, I'm not sure what action we are expected to take for static images; I'm not sure we can be expected to apply high contrast settings to static images.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]At 150% page zoom images present of left side of screen are not visible." (#7880) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1063665
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the #URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Search for a key term (say “json”) from search box.
5. "Packages returned for json" screen gets opened.
6. Zoom the page to 150%.
7. Check if the images present on left side of the screen are visible. 

Actual:
When the page is zoomed to 150% and above upto 200% the images that are present on left side of the screen are not visible.

Same issue is Observed in "Chrome" also.

Expected:
At 150% page zoom all the content and images that are visible in 100% zoom must also be visible at 150% and above upto 200%.

Notes:
This is actually an issue with the 150% zoom shrinking the horizontal width of the page to the point that the bootstrap stuff kicks in and hides the column with the icon. If I recall, this was by design as we decided that the icon eats up too much space at that width. We should revisit this decision and see if we still agree that this is the correct behaviour.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]"Learn more" link is not descriptive." (#7879) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1062807
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the #URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Manage Organizations” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Add New" control and hit enter.
6. Turn on narrator, navigate to "Learn" more link using Tab key.
7. Observe Narrator announcement.

Actual:
Narrator not announces "Learn More" link in descriptive. 
When "Learn More" link receives Narrator focus it does not describe what the learn more link means.

Same issue is Observed in "Chrome+NVDA" also.

Same issue is Observed for controls "Learn More" and "Read More" in  Scenario "UploadPackage_Verify". Below is the screenshot.
Image
Expected:
The narrator should announce a short description about the learn more link.

Notes:
Not exactly sure what is expected to be announced here since "Learn more" is already in the context of the organizations page. We could update the "Learn More" link to include an aria-label with the text "Learn more about organizations on NuGet.Org"

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Narrator unnecessarily announces the word expanded for the Cancel button." (#7878) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1062759

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit the #URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Create" button and hit enter.
6. Enter Values in "Key Name" and "Glob Pattern" field and hit enter on Create button.
7. Navigate to "Manage" control and hit enter on "Edit" control.
8. Navigate to cancel button
9. Turn on the narrator 
10. Check if the narrator announces the cancel button correctly. 

Actual:
Narrator announces the name of the cancel button incorrectly. Narrator announces cancel button like "Cancel button expanded".  

Same issue is observed in chrome+NVDA

Similar issue has been observed in following:
1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Create" button and hit enter, Select Push Checkbox.
6. "Select Packages" section gets enabled.
7. Navigate to 'Cancel' button and check the announcement by narrator.

Expected:
Narrator should not announce expanded along with cancel button.  
Narrator should announce only Cancel button.

Notes:
I was unable to reproduce the behaviour in the second scenario.
In the first scenario, the button gets the aria-expanded="true" attribute, which causes narrator to read it as expanded. However, in that case, the button is a collapser for the expanded dialog (from edit). Not 100% sure what we should do here. Removing aria-expanded="true" from the element will "fix" this bug, but I'm not convinced that this is the correct behaviour.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Keyboard focus is lost after "Delete" button." (#7877) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1062703

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Launch application using provided URL.(https://www.nuget.org/)
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Create" button and hit enter.
6. Enter Values in "Key Name" and "Glob Pattern" field and hit enter on Create button.
7. Navigate to "Manage" control and hit enter.
8. Navigate to the "delete"  button.
9. Check the keyboard focus after delete button.

Actual:
The Keyboard focus is lost after "Delete" button. The keyboard focus is not visible anywhere on the screen after the  delete button focus. 

Expected:
The focus should be visible on the next control after the delete button.

Notes:
This is indicating that keyboard focus is lost after the "Delete" button is interacted. Tabbing afterwards correctly brings focus to the following element, so it appears that the focus is not so much lost as it is not correctly moved forward. We need to focus the next element when delete is pressed so the element with focus is visible. Possibly related stackoverflow https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7208161/focus-next-element-in-tab-index

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Narrator does not announce the error message "At least one scope must be selected" after unchecking the 'Push' button." (#7876) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1062059

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch application URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. "API Keys" screen gets opened.
6. Navigate to create button expand it.
7. Start the Narrator.
8. Navigate to  'push' check box and press enter.
9. Observe the error message "At least one scope must be selected" is  announced by the
  screen reader or not.

Actual:
Narrator does not announce error message(At least one scope must be selected) after unchecking the 'Push' checkbox.

Same issue observed for the below scenario.
1.Upload Package_Custom
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Custom" control and hit enter.
6. Start the screen reader
7. Navigate to "preview" button with out filling any data and hit enter.
8. Observe that screen reader does not announces the below mentioned error.
Image

2.Upload Package_Url
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Url" control and hit enter.
6. Start the screen reader
7. Navigate to "preview" button with out filling any data and hit enter.
8. Observe that screen reader does not announces the below mentioned error.
Image

3.Upload Package_Files
1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select “Upload Package” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. Navigate to "Files" control and hit enter.
6. Start the screen reader
7. Navigate to "preview" button with out filling any data and hit enter.
8. Observe that screen reader does not announces the below mentioned error.
Image

Expected:
 Narrator should announce the error message(At least one scope must be selected) after unchecking the 'Push' checkbox.

Notes:
Should be fixed by adding proper aria-live tags to region where error message will be displayed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Optional configurable thread settings" (#7870) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Enables to set up thread pool in app service. Cloud service was set up through startup.ps1

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Shrink Gallery secret caching to 6 hours and update dependencies. " (#7873) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Shrink Gallery secret caching to 6 hours and update dependencies.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org - Stage 2" (#7875) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
As announced in the blog post [here](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org/), it's time to permanently remove support for TLS 1.0, 1.1.
Exact date in April is TBD and will be announced several weeks in advance.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Proxy package icons that are not served over SSL" (#2613) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: For example on https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Data.OData/5.0.0.50403 there is a JS security error `SEC7111: HTTPS security is compromised by http://static.tumblr.com/hgchgxz/9ualgdf98/icon.png`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fix nuget.exe push help for the source argument" (#9265) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: It incorrectly says the argument should be the server URL, but in fact it should be the source name as defined in the nuget.config file.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Namespace no longer found on build server after migrated to package reference" (#9320) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

I have a rather big application based on .net framework 4.7.2 which so far uses package.config. I now wanted to migrate that project step by step to package reference. So I migrated one project via the VS option. After that I was able to build without issue on my local machine. But as soon as I push it on our TeamCity Server I get a lot of missing namespace errors in the sense of:
```
FieldFactoryTest.cs(3, 7): error CS0246: The type or namespace name 'Xunit' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)
                    Operations\ConditionalCorrectionOperationFactoryTest.cs(6, 7): error CS0246: The type or namespace name 'Moq' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)
```
The packages are correctly restored, I can see those in the .nuget\packages folder of the executing user. Also it works with other projects and I don't see a difference in configuration. But that would point that the necessary packages are installed and that package refernece in general is supported.

From what I saw in the project.assets.json it looks correct as well. I have it attached here.

[project.assets.json.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/4357265/project.assets.json.zip)

The reference in the .csproj looks similar to other project where it works locally and on the build server as well as far as I can tell:
```
    <PackageReference Include="Castle.Windsor">
      <Version>5.0.1</Version>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="coverlet.msbuild">
      <Version>2.8.0</Version>
      <IncludeAssets>runtime; build; native; contentfiles; analyzers; buildtransitive</IncludeAssets>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="KcaLibrary.Core">
      <Version>2.1.4</Version>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="Moq">
      <Version>4.13.1</Version>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="MSTest.TestAdapter">
      <Version>2.1.0</Version>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="MSTest.TestFramework">
      <Version>2.1.0</Version>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe">
      <Version>4.7.0</Version>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions">
      <Version>4.5.3</Version>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="xunit">
      <Version>2.4.1</Version>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="xunit.runner.visualstudio">
      <Version>2.4.1</Version>
      <IncludeAssets>runtime; build; native; contentfiles; analyzers; buildtransitive</IncludeAssets>
      <PrivateAssets>none</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
```

I also tried at one point creating just a new project, but with the same result. Is  there any known issue in that direction or any idea how I can further investigate that?

I'm sorry if that is not the the exactly right place for my question, but I can't think of any other place to ask anymore.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
NuGet.exe, dotnet.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
5.4
dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):
````
.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   3.1.101
 Commit:    b377529961

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  6.3.9600
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win81-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.101\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 3.1.1
  Commit:  a1388f194c

.NET Core SDKs installed:
  2.1.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.401 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.803 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  3.0.102 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  3.1.101 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET Core runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.3 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.15 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.3 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.15 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.0.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]

  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.1.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.0.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.1.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
